newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Sept 26.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - Sept 26.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
* The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd A$16.20 (+0.28)

BHP Managing Director John Prescott said late on Wednesday that he had no doubt that cash costs at BHP's Magma Copper unit in the United States would be cut from their current 85 cents per pound. He also said that one-offs would on balance benefit BHP's second quarter results and that he was reviewing the due diligence process carried out when BHP bought Magma in January.

Lion Nathan Ltd chief executive Douglas Myers confirmed on Wednesday the brewer's market share had declined in its largest sphere, Australia. Myers said market share had dropped to 42.0 percent from 43.1 percent in February.

News Corp's FOX television network placed fourth in the ratings survey of the first week of the 1996/97 U.S. television season. NBC took the top spot with an 11.8 percent share, according to Neilsen Media Research. CBS was second with 10.8 percent, ABC network was third with 9.9 percent and Fox was fourth with 6.3 percent. News also announced the formal conclusion of its merger with New World Communications. News' British unit News International also announced a pact with British Telecom Plc to launch an internet service designed for the British Mass consumer market.

Sons of Gwalia Ltd said on Wednesday it has control of takeover target and fellow Western Australian gold miner Orion Resources NL. Sons of Gwalia is offering A$1.80 per Orion share and has already declared the bid unconditional. The miner said it was now entitled to 52.52 percent of Orion shares on a diluted basis.
